channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet Greg Abel, the new boss of Berkshire Hathaway—Warren Buffett’s successor started out by selling empty soda bottles for 5 cents and now he’s a billionaire CEO
item.description: Warren Buffett’s successor Greg Abel first made money dispersing fliers and redeeming empty soda bottles. Now he's the billionaire CEO of Berkshire Ha...

item.title: Starbucks CEO Announces a Huge Change to Win Back Customers
item.description: The chain is also closing more than 400 stores.

item.title: Flu virus tracker: Latest update shows high influenza activity across most states. Watch out for these symptoms
item.description: As today is the first Monday of 2026, Americans across the country are settling back into their everyday routines after the busy holiday season. But m...

item.title: Employers Are Turning to This 2.5-Pound Device to Save Millions on Manual Labor
item.description: The costs of workplace injuries and accidents may be rising. This startup’s hardware could cut those dramatically.

item.title: How 2026 tax changes could leave more money in your paycheck
item.description: Your paycheck could be a little bigger in 2026, even if you didn’t get a New Year’s raise. That’s because, in order to adjust for inflation, the IRS m...

item.title: U.S. quietly expands list of countries whose citizens must pay up to $15,000 bonds for visas
item.description: The Trump administration has added seven countries, including five in Africa, to the list of nations whose passport holders are required to post bonds...

item.title: Forget an MBA: Hasbro forces workers to sit through a Monopoly-style board game to see if they’re fit for the C-suite—and it’s a tactic approved by Reid Hoffman
item.description: Toy giant Hasbro is using a strategy game to train future CEOs—and leaders like Reid Hoffman and Elon Musk have long been fans of using games to learn...

item.title: This New Gadget Is an AI Wearable That Will Transcribe Your Meetings
item.description: The latest version of the Plaud device will handle more than 100 languages.

item.title: The UK just banned junk food ads before 9pm and across the internet
item.description: For Americans, the idea of watching live television without the constant barrage of commercials for prescription medications and junk food might seem ...

item.title: ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry says toppling of Venezuela’s Maduro will weaken Russia’s global standing as its oil ‘just became less important’
item.description: Russia’s oil exports are its “lifeline” and largely fund its war on Ukraine, says one economist.

item.title: Boston Dynamics CEO Says Robots Will Replace Workers for One Particular Type of Labor
item.description: The robots aren’t coming for everyone’s jobs—just a specific kind.

item.title: Gen Z Is Ditching Stanley Cups for a $40 Water Bottle Thanks to 1 Critical Feature
item.description: Inc. 5000 honoree HydroJug’s ‘leak-proof’ straw is giving challengers a run for their money.

item.title: Does self-improvement in 2026 start on TikTok?
item.description: How seriously are you taking your 2026 rebrand? Do you have your 365 buttons ready? If this means nothing to you, you likely spent the holiday period ...

item.title: Janet Yellen warns the $38 trillion national debt is testing a red line economists have feared for decades
item.description: Top economists fear the era of fiscal dominance is here, and we’ve abandoned the debt problem already.

item.title: Could Venezuela be another Iraq or Afghanistan? Lessons from American statecraft in force and legitimacy
item.description: Reemoving a leader — even a brutal and incompetent one — is not the same as advancing a legitimate political order.
